bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, September 7, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 14. Consulate-General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, September 7, 1892
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
D H Clair You need take no action in this despatch. It is correct by a diplomatic despatch that I am answering. It will send it I own later-- C W Cr
No. 14. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 7, 1892.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor and pleasure of stating that Liberia now has a newspaper a copy of which I inclose.
It is published by and under the direction of this Government.
As there are a number of important articles in this issue I send the entire paper.
